itunesq

Class Preferences

  • Object
    • Preferences
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public final class Preferences
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Class that represents user preferences. This is a singleton class.
    Author:
    Jon
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • updateSaveDirectory

        public static void updateSaveDirectory(String directory)
        Sets the preferences save directory, and moves the existing preferences file and log files to the new directory.
        Parameters:
        directory - preferences save directory

      • initializeLogging

        public void initializeLogging()
        Initializes the logger for this class.

        This cannot be done in the constructor, because calling registerLogger from the constructor would cause an endless loop, in turn because registerLogger needs to access this class.

      • updatePreferences

        public void updatePreferences(Preferences prefs)
        Updates the preferences from a preferences object. This is expected to be called after reading the serialized preferences.
        Parameters:
        prefs - deserialized preferences object

      • readPreferences

        public Preferences readPreferences()
                            throws IOException,
                                   ClassNotFoundException
        Deserializes the preferences from disk.
        Returns:
        deserialized preferences
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs trying to read the preferences file.
        ClassNotFoundException - If the class of a serialized object cannot be found.

      • writePreferences

        public void writePreferences()
                      throws IOException
        Serializes the preferences to disk.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs trying to write the preferences file.
